p: In all probiotic yogurts containing essential oils and extracts of the F. angulata plant, the viscosity increased compared to the control treatment. The addition of FAEO was more effective in increasing viscosity compared to FAEE ( p < .05). There was no significant difference in the viscosity of probiotic yogurts containing 0.2% and 0.4% F. angulata ( p < .05). The treatment containing 0.01% of essential oil had the highest viscosity on the first and 21st days (0.51 ± 0.02 pa.s & 0.37 ± 0.07 pa.s). Over time, viscosity was significantly reduced in all probiotic yogurts containing the extracts and essential oils of F. angulata ( p < .05; Table 6).
